intro: Papaver urbanianum, commonly known as the urban poppy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow. Native to Central and Eastern Europe, this plant typically grows in disturbed soils and urban environments. The plant features smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release seeds. It is often found in roadsides, waste areas, and along railway tracks.
